STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 8, 2021
Zoe Lyons
Jackson County DHHS
301 E Louis Glick Highway
Jackson, MI 49201
RE: License #: CP380201203
Jackson County DHHS
301 E Louis Glick Highway
Jackson, MI 49201
Dear Ms. Lyons:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
1/04/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved. For repeat violations
identify why the previous CAP did not correct the issue, as well as what will
be done moving forward to assure compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram, at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP380201203
Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Address: 235 South Grand Avenue
Lansing, MI 48902
Licensee Telephone #: (517) 373-3768
Administrator/Licensee Designee: Zoe Lyons, Administrator
Jooyeun Chang, Designee
Name of Facility: Jackson County DHHS
Facility Address: 301 E Louis Glick Highway
Jackson, MI 49201
Facility Telephone #: (517) 780-7400
Original Issuance Date: 03/01/1992
Service Types: PLACE CHILDREN FOR ADOPTION
CERTIFY FOSTER HOMES FOR LICENSE
SUPERVISE INDEPENDENT LIVING
PLACE CHILDREN IN FOSTER HOME

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been given an
application for renewal of the license not less than 60 calendar days
before the expiration date of the license.
Two of six foster home licensing files did not have documentation of applications
provided within 60 days prior to license expiration.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15 calendar
days before the expiration date of the foster home license.
Two of six foster home licensing files held renewal evaluations that were not submitted
at least 15 days prior to expiration.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 2/26/20, CAP approved 3/13/20.
Renewal evaluation dated 1/15/19, CAP approved 2/7/19.
R 400.12403 Policy and procedures.
(2) The policies and procedures shall cover at least all of the
following areas: (e) Medical and dental care.
Agency policy (FOM 801) a dental exams within 90 days of entry into
foster care and every 12 months thereafter.
Two of eight foster care files did not have a dental exam on file.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child and
parent or parents, as follows: (a) Within 30 calendar days from
removal from the home.
4

One of eight foster care files did not meet this requirement. The youth re-entered foster
care on 10/21/20. As of this review, a 30 day service plan had not been completed.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Renewal evaluation dated 1/15/19, CAP approved 2/7/19.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child and
parent or parents, as follows: (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of eight foster care files did not meet this requirement. A USP was due by 10/4/20.
However, it was not completed until 10/26/20.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 2/26/20, CAP approved 3/13/20.
Renewal evaluation dated 1/15/19, CAP approved 2/7/19.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following…
(a) All of the following personal information pertaining to the
youth: (xii) A photograph updated on an annual basis.
One of three IL files did not meet this requirement. The most recent photo on file was
dated 10/24/19.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
FOM 722-08E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary
An Action Summary (DHHS 69) must be completed as follows:
5

Foster Care/ Juvenile Justice Program/Case Closure: Within three
business days of foster care and/or juvenile justice program/case
closure, the caseworker must document…
Placement Change: Prior to a planned placement change, or within
three business days of an emergency placement change, the
caseworker must document…
Five of eight closed files held action summaries that were not completed within the
required timeframe. Technical assistance was provided in this area, as noted in section
5.
One of eight open files held an action summary that not completed in the required
timeframe. The youth moved on 5/13/20 and the summary was completed 6/4/20.
FOM 722-08C Foster Care- Parent Agency Treatment Plan & Service
Agreement
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate, including
those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care worker, supervisor, foster
parent, caregiver, any youth age 14 and older and in the case of
placement agency foster care cases, the local DHS office designee.
CI 17-099
All treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or later must
have signatures from all appropriate case members within 30 days of
the report date.
6

Five of eight foster care files held PATPs that were not signed within the required
timeframe.
File one: The 6/24/20 and 9/22/20 PATPs were missing parent signatures.
File two: The 4/7/20 PATP did not have the youth’s signature. PATPs for April, July, and
October did not have signatures, or documentation to show the reports were mailed to
the incarcerated parent.
File three: The 7/5/20 and 10/2/20 PATPs did not have the mother’s signature. The
4/6/20 PATP did not have the father or foster parent signatures. The 7/5/20 PATP did
not have the father’s signature.
File four: The 3/21/20 PATP did not have any signatures documented.
File five: The 4/24/20 PATP was signed by the foster parent, but not dated and
therefore it could not be verified the signature was within the required timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 2/26/20, CAP approved 3/13/20.
FOM 801 Medical passport
For each child in foster care the supervising agency must maintain a
medical passport containing all items listed in MCL 722.954c.
All medical information within the medical passport must be current
and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's current and
complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to: Legal parents…
Quarterly; At reunification.
Seven of eight foster care files did not meet this requirement:
File one: No medical passports (MP) were located in the file.
File two: MP was not updated quarterly. Documentation was missing to verify the May
MP was provided to the parents.
File three: MP had not been updated since 9/30/19.
File four: MP was not updated quarterly.
File five: No MPs were completed during this review period, except for one on 12/9/20.
File six: No MP completed during this review period.
File seven: A quarterly updated MP was missing for April 2020.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 2/26/20, CAP approved 3/13/20.
Renewal evaluation dated 1/15/19, CAP approved 2/7/19.
FOM 722-06B Family team meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames:
 Case Plan Development/ Reassessment Initial Case Plan (ISP) -
within 14 calendar days before the case plan due date.
7

 Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date.
 Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every FTM.
Five of eight foster care files were missing requirements of this policy:
File one: An 1105 was not completed for the March, June, and September FTMs.
File two: An 1105 was not completed for the June and September FTMs.
File three: An FTM and 1105 were not completed prior to the November USP.
File four: An FTM was not completed prior to the 4/6/20 USP. The October FTM was
held after the USP approval and an1105 was not completed.
File five: An FTM was not completed prior to the 3/21/20 USP.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 2/26/20, CAP approved 3/13/20.
Renewal evaluation dated 1/15/19, CAP approved 2/7/19.
FOM 722-06H Timely entry of casework contacts
All face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS, within five
business days of the contact.
All other social work contacts must be entered prior to the report period
end date on the applicable case service plan.
One of eight foster care files held several contacts which were not entered into
MISACWIS within the required timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Interim review dated 2/26/20, CAP approved 3/13/20.
IV. ANALYST FINDINGS:
No safety concerns were identified by the DCWL analyst during this review period.
V. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Clarification was provided that quarterly IL agreements are required by licensing
rules for youth in Young Adult Voluntary Foster Care, in addition to the YAVFC
contract being completed at the onset of the case.
8

Rule 327 requires the agency to provide a copy of a special evaluation report to the
caseworker of any children placed in the foster home. During this review it was
determined that a report had not been provided to a caseworker. The agency stated
the report was not provided as the child was no longer in the home at the conclusion
of the investigation. The agency was advised that although the rule does not
specify, the report should be provided to workers of children that are in the home at
any time during the investigation, in order to keep the worker apprised of findings
that may involve the child.
VI. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
During the review it was determined the agency had difficulty meeting the
requirement for DHHS-69 forms to be completed within three days of the court
hearing for case closure, due to a delay in receiving court orders. The DHHS Policy
office was contacted and stated that the form could be counted as timely if it were
completed within three days of receipt of the court order, rather than three days from
the closing hearing.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The CAP was submitted as a result of the 2/26/20 interim review. During this review
period there were six repeat violations from the 2/26/20 interim evaluation and five
repeat violations from the 1/15/19 renewal evaluation. In most areas the occurrence
of repeat violation was low. However, it is noted that there are several cases in
which violations were found regarding Medical Passports, PATP signatures, and
FTMs. Although it is understandable the agency had difficulty in these areas due to
limitations in contact as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, a CAP will need to be
developed to further address the violations.
9

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, or policy. Upon receipt of an acceptable
corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of
their regular license.
January 7, 2021
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
January 7, 2021
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
10
